result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George C Welch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, George C Welch, in custody, appeared with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:23)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Kelm - 16CF43 - plea to Ct 2 with repeater, dismiss & readin ct 1 - 15CM397 dismissed & readin - w/held 1 yr prob - pay rest $558.80, aoda, cc - no jail time
State - City wants to pursue their case - argues sentence
Kelm - agreement is appropriate

Deft - 16CF43 Ct 2 with repeater - pleads no contest - waives rights and JT

COURT:  16CF43 Ct 2 with repeater - plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 1 yr probation
$243 cc
$200 dna surchg
***PAYMENT PLAN***
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
restitution $558.80 includes surcharge
AODA and follow thru
86 days credit if revoked

DISMISS & READIN: 15CM397, 16CF43 Ct 1
16TR322 set with City attorney

Defendant, George C Welch, in custody, appeared with Attorney Evan Thomas Bins Nordgren.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  2:34 pm
Atty Nordgren requests another date.  Br. 2 cases may be resolved and this case will be part of agreement.  
Nordgren argues bond.  
COURT:  $100 signature bond.  If no agreement, return case to Br. I  Plea hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant, George C Welch, in custody, appeared w/Evan Nordgren.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  11:37 am

Def waives reading, pleads not guilty, waives speedy trial

COURT:  $25 cash bond  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant, George C Welch failed to appear.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  12:17

State will do personal service  Initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:45 am.
